objects.name: Context Reframed by Edits to Media
objects.description:
Media which has been edited through cropping (zooming in from a larger image), clipping (taking a short section from a longer piece of content), or otherwise making changes to content in such a way that its meaning is changed, or that it can support a new incorrect or misleading interpretation of events.

To make this assertion, analysts need to identify the original source which a piece of content has come from, and confirm that the content has been edited in such a way that the context of the original media is lost or changed.

Indicators include abrupt transitions, mismatched lighting or shadows, or inconsistencies between visual and audio elements.
